intro: Lepidaploa bolivarensis, commonly known as the Bolivian lepidaploa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth texture and a slightly pubescent surface. Lepidaploa bolivarensis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
